thread.title: WTF Happened to This Guy's Bicep?
thread.title_full: WTF Happened to This Guy's Bicep?

author: Barry K
title: WTF Happened to This Guy's Bicep?
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us Landon MacDonald 
The injury is called a detached bicep, and it occurs when your biceps tendon tears at your elbow. Watch the video above to learn the insane true story of how it happened. 
When I saw the doctor, he said he could reattach my bicep. The problem: Doing that would require surgery and I’d be out of commission for awhile. At the time, I had an upcoming UFC fight and I was also training Tier 1 Military units, the highest level Special Forces groups. These are the type of guys who carry out intense raids and don’t exist on paper. 
If I underwent surgery, I’d miss the fitness seminar they’d scheduled me to teach them. I didn’t want to let those guys down, so I decided to not have the injury fixed. I went on to teach that team of Special Forces operators my elite 6-month fitness program, which I later included in my Men's Health book, Maximus Body . 
Because I never had the injury fixed, I’ve lost about 10 percent of my biceps strength. Oh well—it hasn’t slowed me down too much, and I don’t regret not letting those soldiers down.
